metadata.title: USN-7131-1 -- Vim vulnerability
metadata.description: It was discovered that Vim incorrectly handled memory when closing a buffer, leading to use-after-free. If a user was tricked into opening a specially crafted file, an attacker could crash the application, leading to a denial of service.  Update Instructions:  Run `sudo pro fix USN-7131-1` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected by updating your system to the following package versions:  vim - 2:9.1.0496-1ubuntu6.2 vim-athena - 2:9.1.0496-1ubuntu6.2 vim-common - 2:9.1.0496-1ubuntu6.2 vim-doc - 2:9.1.0496-1ubuntu6.2 vim-gtk3 - 2:9.1.0496-1ubuntu6.2 vim-gui-common - 2:9.1.0496-1ubuntu6.2 vim-motif - 2:9.1.0496-1ubuntu6.2 vim-nox - 2:9.1.0496-1ubuntu6.2 vim-runtime - 2:9.1.0496-1ubuntu6.2 vim-tiny - 2:9.1.0496-1ubuntu6.2 xxd - 2:9.1.0496-1ubuntu6.2 No subscription required
